result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Wayne Hulsey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: **Amended 8/8/16 to indicate defendant can be discharged after 1 year upon application to the Court.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall possess prescription medications only with a valid prescription and take in manner and method as prescribed by his physician.
Defendant shall obtain prescription from only 1 pharmacy and notify Agent within 72 hours of any changes to prescriptions.

Court finds def. waives his rights, finds a factual basis exists and finds def. guilty of Ct. #1 and Ct. #4.  Ct. #2 and Ct. #3 D&RI.
Recommendations by counsel.
Probation - SW - 2 years concurrent.
Eligible for early discharge after 1 year if def. complies with all conditions - upon Agent's application to the court.
Conditions:
1.  pay costs of the action.
2.  pay supervision fees.
3.  def. to participate in any assessments and counseling deemed appropriate by his Agent and follow treatment recommendations arising therefrom.
4.  def. shall not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
5.  def. to possess prescription medications only with a valid prescription and take in manner and method as prescribed by his physician.
6.  def. to obtain prescriptions from only 1 pharmacy and notify Agent w/in 72 hours of any changes to prescriptions.
7.  def. to supply DNA sample.
